alert.note: Alert for Custer; Lincoln (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 11:37PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Lincoln and Custer Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1136 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles southwest of Dunning to near Brady. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Broken Bow, Arnold, Callaway, Sargent, Merna, Oconto, Anselmo, Berwyn, Weissert, Lillian, Round Valley, Etna, Walworth, Milldale, Burr Oak, Lodi, Buckeye, and Pleasant Hill. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 near mile marker 110, and between mile markers 115 and 121. Highway 2 between mile markers 249 and 290. Highway 92 between mile markers 250 and 273. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southwestern Nebraska.
